tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE customer_churn_rate_monitoring (
    customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_name VARCHAR(50),
    subscription_type VARCHAR(50),
    churn_date TIMESTAMP,
    reason_for_churn VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE churn_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT,
    log_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    log_message TEXT
    FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customer_churn(customer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE customer_feedback (
    feedback_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT,
    feedback TEXT,
    response TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(customer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE ChurnRates (
  customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  churn_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE CustomerFeedback (
  feedback_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT,
  feedback_text TEXT,
  feedback_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE CustomerDetails (
  customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_name VARCHAR(50),
  contact_number VARCHAR(15),
  address TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE CustomerInteractions (
  interaction_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT,
  interaction_date DATE,
  interaction_type VARCHAR(50),
  interaction_details TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE customers (
  customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_name VARCHAR(255),
  address VARCHAR(255),
  email VARCHAR(255),
  churn_status BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE products (
  product_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  product_name VARCHAR(255),
  price DECIMAL(10, 2),
  category VARCHAR(50),
  available_stock INT
);

CREATE TABLE orders (
  order_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT,
  product_id INT,
  order_date DATE,
  quantity INT,
  total_price DECIMAL(10, 2)
);
